page.title: 05GAME REARING.
page.content: { PHEASANT}shooting occurs in this area.The 3000 acre local Estate,this year,bought 650 day-old ckicks in {MARKET WEIGHTON}to rear.For a week, they are kept in small pens,warmed by gas heaters and fed on pellets made in {TADCASTER.}They are moved on to large, plastic-covered pens,called Sunhouses, still heated,giving them more room. This is the hardest time for the Game- keeper since the birds "shock" very easily.After 3 weeks,the heat is turned off to harden the Pheasants. After 5 more weeks they are put in open-topped "Release Pens" with their wings clipped.They moult,grow new wing feathers,then fly off,but still return to be fed on{WHEAT}grain. The 'keeper may only deter{Foxes } because they,too,are hunted,but he can set traps for smaller vermin, such as rats, stoats and weasels.
